KING
               
              HENRY
text: horse for her favors, I could lay on like a butcher

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: and sit like a jackanapes, never off. But, before God,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Kate, I cannot look greenly nor gasp out my eloquence,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: nor I have no cunning in protestation, only

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: downright oaths, which I never use till urged, nor

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: never break for urging. If thou canst love a fellow of

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: this temper, Kate, whose face is not worth sun-burning,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: that never looks in his glass for love of

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: anything he sees there, let thine eye be thy cook. I

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: speak to thee plain soldier. If thou canst love me for

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: this, take me. If not, to say to thee that I shall die is

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: true, but for thy love, by the Lord, no. Yet I love thee

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: too. And while thou liv’st, dear Kate, take a fellow of

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: plain and uncoined constancy, for he perforce must

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: do thee right because he hath not the gift to woo in

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: other places. For these fellows of infinite tongue,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: that can rhyme themselves into ladies’ favors, they

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: do always reason themselves out again. What? A

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: speaker is but a prater, a rhyme is but a ballad, a

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: good leg will fall, a straight back will stoop, a black

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: beard will turn white, a curled pate will grow bald,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: a fair face will wither, a full eye will wax hollow, but

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: a good heart, Kate, is the sun and the moon, or

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: rather the sun and not the moon, for it shines bright

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: and never changes but keeps his course truly. If

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: thou would have such a one, take me. And take me,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: take a soldier. Take a soldier, take a king. And what

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: say’st thou then to my love? Speak, my fair, and

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: fairly, I pray thee.

speaker: KATHERINE
text: Is it possible dat I sould love de enemy of

speaker: KATHERINE
text: France?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: No, it is not possible you should love the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: enemy of France, Kate. But, in loving me, you

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: should love the friend of France, for I love France

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: so well that I will not part with a village of it. I will

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: have it all mine. And, Kate, when France is mine

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: and I am yours, then yours is France and you are

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: mine.

speaker: KATHERINE
text: I cannot tell wat is dat.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: No, Kate? I will tell thee in French,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: which I am sure will hang upon my tongue like a

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: new-married wife about her husband’s neck, hardly

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: to be shook off. Je quand sur le possession de

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: France, et quand vous avez le possession de moi—let

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: me see, what then? Saint Denis be my speed!—donc

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: vôtre est France, et vous êtes mienne. It is as easy for

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: me, Kate, to conquer the kingdom as to speak so

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: much more French. I shall never move thee in

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: French, unless it be to laugh at me.

speaker: KATHERINE
text: Sauf votre honneur, le français que vous

speaker: KATHERINE
text: parlez, il est meilleur que l’anglais lequel je parle.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: No, faith, is ’t not, Kate, but thy speaking

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: of my tongue, and I thine, most truly-falsely must

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: needs be granted to be much at one. But, Kate, dost

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: thou understand thus much English? Canst thou

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: love me?

speaker: KATHERINE
text: I cannot tell.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Can any of your neighbors tell, Kate? I’ll

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: ask them. Come, I know thou lovest me; and at

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: night, when you come into your closet, you’ll question

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: this gentlewoman about me, and, I know, Kate,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: you will, to her, dispraise those parts in me that you

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: love with your heart. But, good Kate, mock me

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: mercifully, the rather, gentle princess, because I

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: love thee cruelly. If ever thou beest mine, Kate, as I

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: have a saving faith within me tells me thou shalt, I

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: get thee with scambling, and thou must therefore

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: needs prove a good soldier-breeder. Shall not thou

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: and I, between Saint Denis and Saint George, compound

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: a boy, half French, half English, that shall go

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: to Constantinople and take the Turk by the beard?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Shall we not? What say’st thou, my fair flower de

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: luce?

speaker: KATHERINE
text: I do not know dat.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: No, ’tis hereafter to know, but now to

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: promise. Do but now promise, Kate, you will

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: endeavor for your French part of such a boy; and

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: for my English moiety, take the word of a king and

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: a bachelor. How answer you, la plus belle Katherine

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: du monde, mon très cher et divin déesse?

speaker: KATHERINE
text: Your Majesté ’ave fausse French enough to

speaker: KATHERINE
text: deceive de most sage demoiselle dat is en France.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Now fie upon my false French. By mine

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: honor, in true English, I love thee, Kate. By which

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: honor I dare not swear thou lovest me, yet my blood

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: begins to flatter me that thou dost, notwithstanding

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: the poor and untempering effect of my visage. Now

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: beshrew my father’s ambition! He was thinking of

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: civil wars when he got me; therefore was I created

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: with a stubborn outside, with an aspect of iron, that

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: when I come to woo ladies, I fright them. But, in

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: faith, Kate, the elder I wax, the better I shall appear.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: My comfort is that old age, that ill layer-up of

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: beauty, can do no more spoil upon my face. Thou

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: hast me, if thou hast me, at the worst, and thou shalt

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: wear me, if thou wear me, better and better. And

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: therefore tell me, most fair Katherine, will you have

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: me? Put off your maiden blushes, avouch the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: thoughts of your heart with the looks of an empress,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: take me by the hand, and say “Harry of England, I

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: am thine,” which word thou shalt no sooner bless

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: mine ear withal, but I will tell thee aloud “England

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: is thine, Ireland is thine, France is thine, and Henry

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Plantagenet is thine,” who, though I speak it before

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: his face, if he be not fellow with the best king, thou

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: shalt find the best king of good fellows. Come, your

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: answer in broken music, for thy voice is music, and

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: thy English broken. Therefore, queen of all, Katherine,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: break thy mind to me in broken English. Wilt

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: thou have me?

speaker: KATHERINE
text: Dat is as it shall please de roi mon père.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Nay, it will please him well, Kate; it shall

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: please him, Kate.

speaker: KATHERINE
text: Den it sall also content me.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Upon that I kiss your hand, and I call you

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: my queen.

speaker: KATHERINE
text: Laissez, mon seigneur, laissez, laissez! Ma

speaker: KATHERINE
text: foi, je ne veux point que vous abaissiez votre grandeur,

speaker: KATHERINE
text: en baisant la main d’ une—Notre Seigneur!—

speaker: KATHERINE
text: indigne serviteur. Excusez-moi, je vous supplie, mon

speaker: KATHERINE
text: très puissant seigneur.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Then I will kiss your lips, Kate.

speaker: KATHERINE
text: Les dames et demoiselles, pour être baisées

speaker: KATHERINE
text: devant leurs noces, il n’est pas la coutume de France.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Madam my interpreter, what says she?

speaker: ALICE
text: Dat it is not be de fashion pour les ladies of

speaker: ALICE
text: France—I cannot tell wat is baiser en Anglish.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: To kiss.

speaker: ALICE
text: Your Majesté entendre bettre que moi.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: It is not a fashion for the maids in France

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: to kiss before they are married, would she say?

speaker: ALICE
text: Oui, vraiment.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: O Kate, nice customs curtsy to great

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: kings. Dear Kate, you and I cannot be confined

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: within the weak list of a country’s fashion. We are

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: the makers of manners, Kate, and the liberty that

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: follows our places stops the mouth of all find-faults,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text:
patiently and yielding.
                 
                He
                 
                kisses
                 
                her
                .
               You have

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:

              HENRY

KING
               
              HENRY

KING
               
              HENRY
text: Here comes your father.

text: God save your Majesty. My royal cousin,

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: teach you our princess English?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: I would have her learn, my fair cousin,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: how perfectly I love her, and that is good English.

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: Is she not apt?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: appear in his true likeness.

text: Pardon the frankness of my mirth if I

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: answer you for that. If you would conjure in her,

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: you must make a circle; if conjure up Love in her in

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: his true likeness, he must appear naked and blind.

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: Can you blame her, then, being a maid yet rosed

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: over with the virgin crimson of modesty, if she deny

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: the appearance of a naked blind boy in her naked

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: seeing self? It were, my lord, a hard condition for a

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: maid to consign to.

              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker: BURGUNDY

              HENRY

              HENRY

speaker: BURGUNDY

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: well summered and warm kept are like flies at

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: Bartholomew-tide: blind, though they have their

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: eyes; and then they will endure handling, which

speaker: BURGUNDY
text: before would not abide looking on.

              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
